UMP Sulteng Naik Jadi Rp 2,3 Juta, Ini Pesan Pemda ke Pengusaha
01 Nov 2019, 08:51 by Mohammad Qadri


Ilustrasi/Foto: Muhammad Ridho

Palu - Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) Sulawesi Tengah (Sulteng) naik 8,51%, dari Rp 2.123.040 menjadi Rp 2.303.711. Keputusan ini diatur dalam Surat Keputusan Gubernur Sulteng Longki Djanggola No. 561/425/DIS-NAKERTRANS-G-ST/2019.Dalam keputusan Gubernur tersebut terdapat beberapa ketentuan. Pertama, menetapkan bahwa kesatu UMP ditetapkan sebesar Rp. 2.303.711 per bulan. Kedua, perhitungan upah sehari, seperti perusahaan dengan sistem waktu kerja 6 hari dalam seminggu, upah sebulan dibagi 25 atau perusahaan dengan sistem waktu kerja 5 hari dalam seminggu, dengan upah sebulan dibagi 21.Ketiga, UMP berlaku bagi pekerja/buruh masa kerja nol tahun, status pekerja atau buruh masih lajang dan tidak memiliki keterampilan (non skill).Kepala Dinas Tenaga Kerja dan Transmigrasi Provinsi Sulteng Arnold Firdaus Bandu menyampaikan UMP yang sudah ditetapkan ini berlaku mulai 1 Januari 2020. Arnold menyampaikan, penetapan UMP ini agar bisa dipatuhi perusahaan. Adapun bagi yang belum menyanggupi sesuai dengan UMP yang ditetapkan, Arnold menjelaskan ada mekanisme yang harus dilalui perusahaan tersebut."Bagi perusahaan yang tidak mampu melaksanakan upah tersebut dapat mengajukan penangguhan upah minimum selambat-lambatnya 10 hari sebelum tahun berjalan yang ditujukan kepada Bapak Gubernur melalui Dinas Tenaga Kerja dan Transmigrasi Provinsi Sulteng," ucap Arnold.Bagi perusahaan yang tidak mengajukan penangguhan upah minimum sesuai waktu yang ditetapkan dianggap mampu melaksanakan sesuai dengan UMP yang sudah ditetapkan. Pelaksanaan UMP ini juga kata Arnold akan diawasi oleh Pengawas Ketenagakerjaan."Karena pelanggaran pembayaran upah dikategorikan perbuatan pidana," tegasnya.Simak Video "Asyik! Central Sulawesi UMP Increases to Rp 2.3 Million, This is the Message from the Regional Government to Entrepreneurs
Nov 01 2019, 08:51 by Mohammad Qadri


Illustration / Photo: Muhammad Ridho

Palu - Central Sulawesi (Central Sulawesi) Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) rose 8.51%, from Rp 2,123,040 to Rp 2,303,711. This decision is regulated in the Decree of the Governor of Central Sulawesi Longki Djanggola No. 561/425 / DIS-NAKERTRANS-G-ST / 2019. In the Governor's decision there are several provisions. First, stipulate that one UMP is set at Rp. 2,303,711 per month. Second, the calculation of day wages, such as companies with a system of work time 6 days a week, wages a month divided by 25 or companies with a system of working time 5 days a week, with a month's salary divided by 21. Third, the UMP applies to workers / laborers with zero year work period , the status of the worker or laborer is still single and does not have skills (non-skills). Head of the Central Sulawesi Province Manpower and Transmigration Office, Arnold Firdaus Bandu said that the stipulated UMP is valid from January 1, 2020. Arnold said, the determination of this UMP is to be complied with by the company. As for those who have not agreed in accordance with the stipulated UMP, Arnold explained there is a mechanism that must be passed by the company. "For companies that are unable to carry out these wages can file a deferment of the minimum wage no later than 10 days before the current year addressed to the Governor through the Office Central Sulawesi Province Manpower and Transmigration, "said Arnold. For companies that do not propose a postponement of the minimum wage in accordance with the stipulated time is considered capable of carrying out in accordance with the stipulated UMP. The implementation of the UMP is also said by Arnold to be monitored by the Labor Inspector. "Because violations of wage payments are categorized as criminal acts," he stressed. Watch Video "Fun!
